item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Crimson Blaze Expansion Revealed for Next Week
item.content:encoded:
The Pokemon Company has announced the next Pokemon TCG Pocket expansion, and if you like the original three starters (and their evolved forms, of course), then Crimson Blaze is very much for you.

As revealed on the official Pokemon website, Crimson Blaze will launch on both Android and iOS on December 17th, and following on from the introduction of Mega Evolution in October's Mega Rising expansion, you can expect new Mega Evolution ex cards in this latest set.

New Mega Evolution ex cards for Charizard (in its Y form), Venusaur, and Blastoise will be added for the set, and as The Pokemon Company says, the cards will feature "illustrations that feel like they pop right out of the screen".

As well as the new Mega Evolution cards, you'll also find new cards based on the first forms of the three Gen I starters, plus new cards for 'mon like Ditto, Solosis, and Trubbish, some of which feature full art as well.

Additionally, you'll find new covers and backdrops based on the fearsome form of Mega Charizard Y, which will arrive on New Year's Eve, giving you the perfect opportunity to ring in 2026 with everyone's favorite pseudo-dragon.

News of the latest Pokemon TCG Pocket expansion comes after it was announced back in October that the game had passed the 150 million download mark, which was itself revealed shortly before the digital card game hit its first anniversary later that month.

You can take a look at a trailer for the new Pokemon TCG Pocket expansion Crimson Blaze, which shows off some of its gorgeous new card artwork, right here.

Pokemon TCG Pocket's Crimson Blaze expansion launches on December 17th. You can download the game for free right now on Android and iOS. Stay tuned for more on this and all other things Pokemon TCG Pocket-related.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Helldivers 2 Killzone Content Returns as a Warbond Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Arrowhead and Sony have announced a new Helldivers 2 Warbond, and it's bringing back some popular Killzone crossover content, but this time, it's not on a timer.

Helldivers 2's Killzone crossover first arrived back in December last year, but the items you could acquire as part of the collaboration were on a limited timer, so if you didn't pick them up before a certain point, it seemed like they were gone forever.

Now, though, according to a PlayStation Blog post, the Killzone crossover is returning as a Legendary Warbond, which means, as Arrowhead puts it, that the content is now "back for good", and not only that, but there's more stuff coming to the Warbond as well.

Killzone-themed weapons like the StA-52 assault rifle, the StA-11 SMG, and the PLAS-39 Accelerator will all be making an appearance as part of this Warbond, as will Killzone-based armor sets and patterns for your Exosuit (among other items, of course!).

News of the Helldivers 2 Killzone Warbond comes shortly after it was revealed that the upcoming Helldivers movie has found its director in the form of Fast and Furious helmsman Justin Lin, who will also serve as a producer on the project.

The new Warbond is also not the game's first within the last couple of months; it follows hot on the heels of the Python Commandos Warbond last month, which gave you the chance to equip your Helldivers with a minigun and other outlandish weaponry.

You can check out a trailer for the Helldivers 2 Killzone Warbond, which shows off what you can expect from the crossover, right here.

The Helldivers 2 Killzone Warbond will launch on December 18th, and it'll cost you 1500 Super Credits, so make sure your account is flush enough when the day rolls around.

The game itself is available right now on PC and PlayStation 5, and you can read our review of it right here.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Wario World Joins Nintendo Switch Online GameCube Lineup
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has announced that another retro game has made its way to the Nintendo Switch Online service, and this time, it's beloved GameCube platformer Wario World.

Yesterday, the gaming giant revealed that two N64 platformers would make their way to the service, but now, if you're a Switch 2 player (and a Switch Online Expansion Pack member, of course), you can enjoy a third at no extra cost.

If you're not familiar with Wario World, it's a 3D platformer released for the GameCube back in 2003. Unlike its sister Mario series, Wario World is largely a linear affair that mixes in elements of beat-'em-ups and other genres as well.

Although the game is, of course, published by Nintendo, Wario World was developed by Treasure, best known for run-and-gun games and shooters like Radiant Silvergun and Gunstar Heroes.

At time of writing, Wario World is still the last mainline 3D platformer in which the character appeared; he's starred in WarioWare minigame compilations and 2D sidescrollers since, but Wario World is still the place to go if you want to see him strutting his stuff in 3D.

Wario World joins a number of other GameCube games that have made their way to Nintendo Switch Online; others include the likes of "survival horror" classic Luigi's Mansion and platformer Chibi-Robo!.

They've joined an initial lineup that includes games like The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, F-Zero GX, and SoulCalibur II, and with more being drip-fed to subscribers on a regular basis, it's a good time to be nostalgic for the GameCube.

Wario World is available right now via Nintendo Switch Online, but you will need an Expansion Pack addon to play it. Thankfully, you'll also get access to Genesis, N64, and Game Boy Advance games if you pick it up, so it's not just GameCube titles waiting for you.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
